articles.title: New tectonic plate model shows how Earth was organized as a supercontinent 2.8 million years ago - Daily Mail
articles.description: The new model allowed scientists to include microplates that existed two million years ago. This better explains 'the spatial distribution of 90 percent of earthquakes and 80 percent of volcanoes.
articles.content:
Scientists have produced a new map of Earth's tectonic plates that shows the continents organized like the first supercontinent, Vaalbara, which broke up about 2.8 million years ago.
